DataElement.preferredName: FLT3 Internal Tandem Duplication Allele Ratio Laboratory Procedure Performed Finding Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the laboratory results for FLT3-Internal Tandem Duplication allelic ratio.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FLT3 Internal Tandem Duplication Allele Ratio Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that arises from duplications of the juxtamembrane portion of the gene and results in constitutive activation of the FLT3 receptor tyrosine kinase protein in early hematopoietic progenitor cells. It is associated with acute myelogenous leukemia where it appears to correlate with a poor prognosis._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: FLT3 Internal Tandem Duplication Allele Ratio Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that arises from duplications of the juxtamembrane portion of the gene and results in constitutive activation of the FLT3 receptor tyrosine kinase protein in early hematopoietic progenitor cells. It is associated with acute myelogenous leukemia where it appears to correlate with a poor prognosis.:one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A genetic abnormality that arises from duplications of the juxtamembrane portion of the gene and results in constitutive activation of the FLT3 receptor tyrosine kinase protein in early hematopoietic progenitor cells. It is associated with acute myelogenous leukemia where it appears to correlate with a poor prognosis.

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.
